Reviews.Title: “Not For Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Karl_Lukacs
Reviews.Content: The in-room internet barely worked. There was no proper desk to work at. On my second morning, the hot water was out in the entire hotel because of a pipe burst, and I was forced to cancel meetings which had taken weeks to arrange. The hotel offered a 30 euro discount, but I negotiated 70 euros back in cash and some cost waivers. The H2 is a level-above-hostel hipster tourist hotel akin to The Standard in Hollywood. It was my error for booking it for a serious business trip, but a place that sells itself as young, hip and wired should, at a minimum, have decent in-room internet. I stayed in February 2012 during the European Film Market.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BKBowden
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, great location, exceptionally clean, very helpful staff. The only downside to this hotel is it seems its the one schools and colleges book for their trips and it was full to brimming with students. This made breakfast a very busy affair with a rush to get a seat. I would recommend this hotel but perhaps out of school trip season.

Reviews.Title: “Good value vs price”
Reviews.Author: Letizia G
Reviews.Content: My room was nicer than expected but mostly important the service is great. The room bathroom is very big (compared to the room size) and there is an exceptional shower. I finally got the place to display all my things in the bathroom since there is a lot of place near the sink. There is free WIFI connection working properly everywhere. The breakfast is good although during my stay every morning the restaurant was really crowed and you may wait 5/10 minutes on the line to get your coffee. The prices vs quality is quite high I therefore recommend this hotel. The location is also great since there is a direct bus from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cristina L
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here only 1 night but it was amazing experience.The hotel is new, opened 1 year ago, everything is new, modern and clean. The concept is simple but kept in each small detail. The room was not big but as we spent there only 1 night it was not a problem. I liked the bathroom with heated floor and very ingenious door system. The restaurant is open 24 hours daily, is it a fast food style but with very good choice of meals, mostly healthy stuff. All the staff was very nice and kind. And that they wear jeans? I love it! It just fits to all the rest - if you dont look for luxury full of gold and marmor, go to this hotel because here you get great accommodation for reasonable price with perfect service and human attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable place to sleep and wash up”
Reviews.Author: jmew
Reviews.Content: Stayed a total of 6 nights during my business trip. Good location, 5 mins walk to Alexanderplatz Station with Berliner Fernsehturm and Galeria Kaufhof nearby; and 10-15mins walk to Museum Island. Very basic room amenities, shampoo and body wash. Problems. Intermittent hot and cold water from shower. There is no consistent flow of warm water. It's a mixture of cold, cool, lukewarm and suddenly hot. No matter how the temperature of water was adjusted. Used the same bedlinens for the 6 nights. WIFI reception was low and at times no reception. If you just need a place to sleep, wash up and dont mind not much facilities, this will be fine as their rooms are the same size as next door, Ramada Alexanderplatz.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what was expected”
Reviews.Author: VALENTIN N
Reviews.Content: I stayed in H2 Alexanderplatz for 4 nights during my business trip to Berlin. The choice was initially made due to the hotel`s positioning in Alexanderplatz with good transportation connection both to/ from airport and also to/ from ICC Berlin. The hotel is easy to find, on one of the main boulevards in the area of Alexanderplatz, just a few minutes from U-bahn and S-bahn. Things that made the stay enjoyable: - location; - staff helpfulness; - great free WI-FI connection (probably the best ever in my case); - breakfast; - room (and especially bathroom) facilities (clean and modern); - having booked in advance, the price was ok too; Things that did not go quite well: - the fact that during my stay the hotel was packed with Italian teenagers (Italians + teenagers), quite noisy - obviously this is a subjective matter and I assume you do not risk to run into this situation on everyday basis; - room a little bit smaller in size than expected (hotel`s website advertises bigger sized-rooms, which could be interpreted as unrealistic compared to what one might once checked-in at this hotel) All in all, a recommendable hotel, especially for business travelers, but not only.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and modern....just like Berlin itself”
Reviews.Author: Marisha_11
Reviews.Content: I was in H2 hotel for a business trip. I liked the minimalist decor of the room, very comfortable bed and bedlinen. Everything impeccably clean. Shower fixtures are the height of design, very impressive. Despite the big crowds at breakfast (the hotel was full of schoolchildren), the staff coped so well, - the food was always in good supply and everything was cleaned and sorted out quickly. Great coffee machine in the breakfast area with tasty coffee. But the real acid test of this hotel was when the fire alarm went out in the evening (I still don't know whether it was a drill or the real fire break-out), everyone (and yes, there were lots and lots of school-kids) was evacuated in 2-3 minutes, not more, and escorted to the assembly point. Very impressive. Helpful and polite staff at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: halopes
Reviews.Content: The hotel feels rather new. It's not classic neither it is very romantic but it will suit the needs of many. Decoration is minimalist and the rooms are modern and comfortable with big, functional bathrooms. The windows are big and the AC is super-silent. There is no safe or mini-bar but there is free wifi (weak signal in some rooms though). Location is good, right next to Alexanderplatz. The staff is young yet helpful, friendly and professional. Breakfast is good but having it at 9am was hellishly - the space simply can't accomodate so many people. There was a queue of 20 people to the coffee machine, food was running out, people were fighting for tables, etc. Overall, incredible value for money.

Reviews.Title: “All you need in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mariolloret
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located perfectly, the style is low cost but modern too. Free wifi and clean bedrooms, maybe a little bit small but I don't mind. Probably the only disappointing thing was that there weren't any closet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy, modern & close”
Reviews.Author: russellbrown181
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. very clean & modern. Tv in the room but only English channels are the news but that's ok. beds comfy but pillows weren't very good. Air conditioning and heating was first class, as was the heated bathroom floor. The bathroom was lovely. Nice big shower with two heads. Shower gel & shampoo & towels all very good. Free Ipads in reception area were very useful as we used google maps on these to plan our days sight seeing. Check in was very good & staff very helpful. Lifts were always available & we never had to wait in the four days we were at the hotel. Breakfast was very good, as much coffee, juice, cereal & meats you could eat. As well as eggs & yoghurts. I even nabbed some fruit for later on in the day. The location is excellent. We got the r7 train from schoenefeld airport to Alexanderplatz & the hotel is a 3 minute walk from there so commuting was very easy. All the sights we wanted to see were in walking distance. We saw, eastside gallery, reichtag, brandenburg gate, checkpoint charlie & the jewish memorial amongst others & we walked to all of these.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: Katelijn V
Reviews.Content: Clean and modern compact rooms. Location: Alexanderplatz, central through not charming Rooms: clean and modern, modern bathroom, flatscreen in room and desk, bed is not too big though Breakfast: Excellend buffet for the price including eggs and bacon. Coffee from the machine though, no fresh filter coffee. Staff: Friendly As far as I remember internet is wifi on room and for free but did not try it out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly priced and perfectly placed”
Reviews.Author: The_Peppin-Hugheses
Reviews.Content: 62 Euro's for a fantastic central hotel on a Saturday night has to be a bargain. We really liked this stylish, clean and friendly hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Anton62
Reviews.Content: If you can come to terms with the "bubbles" logo everywhere , we found this hotel as good value for money as you are likely to find. Excellent location, with lots going on (particularly lots of fireworks, as it was a New Year trip!) nearby. Our room was clean and although basic and a bit small, was ample for the two of us. Excellent bathroom - the shower is very powerful. Front of house was friendly and patient (the constant coming and going of people would try anyone's patience). The breakfast set up was casual and spread around the ground floor - I think people could easily come in off the street and no-one would know. The food was plentiful and of a good quality. I think the location is its best asset. So close to the museums, Cathedral and a whole host of other landmarks. The railway station with direct link to the airport is less than five mins walk. Perfect. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants good service without too many frills. Would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: dreamiegurl
Reviews.Content: variety buffet breakfast ! nearby sightseeing bus point, tv tower n megamall, trams, subway. the room is small but its ok, its clean. just a shame it doesnt have a coffee maker, am fine without a fridge but i need my caffein fix. best hotel shower ! definitely will stay again at this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small room, good price”
Reviews.Author: GerryBasso
Reviews.Content: Not so far from city center, close to subway, very clean. Young staff, quite friendly. The room for two adults and two kids was looking as a boat cabin, but very nice, bathroom was quite nice for three stars hotel. Breakfast as a self service, quite noisy and getting full with fifty people. I would recommend it for a short staying, two or three days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Sonia B
Reviews.Content: I have just return from a 3 day trip to Berlin with my mother for the Christmas Markets through Leger Holidays and the H2 hotel is very well situated in Alexander Platz area of the city. The Hotel is clean, bright and within a 5 minute walk of the platz for buses, trams and overground links to all of this wonderful city's attraction. the walk to them is also possible. the hotel breakfast area was very crowded and people had to wait for seats on both Saturday and Sunday. however, the breakfast was plentiful when you did get a seat. The rooms are a little on the small size but the shower is fab, very powerful lots and lots of hot water. It would help if there was tea and coffee making in the room and maybe some tissues, just little things but can help if needed. I would recommend the hotel and would certainly stay there again when returning to Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Too many circles”
Reviews.Author: caroleburrows9
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and conveniently situated, very modern and facilities good (although we had to breakfast in the next door Ramada). The ultra modern decor, with lots of circles, gets a bit overwhelming, and our room was a little tight with a small walking space between the end of the bed and the cupboards. Staff were generally friendly and helpful and particular congrats to the staff in the "Freshness Zone" (Snack Bar/Shop) who were often multi rasking but still gave speedy and efficient service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JEFFERZ
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. Caught the train from Schoenberg airport on arrival and the bus to Tegel airport on departure, ideal location for both.Rooms are not large but extremely well designed. Bathroom is cleverly designed and the shower is great. Also has the best tap water I think I've ever tasted. Beds are comfy, ( more pillows available at reception) and very quiet room. Heated floor in bathroom is lovely. At first I was disappointed there were no tea/coffee making facilities in room but cafe in lobby is open 24/7 so no worries. Staff are fantastic. Brand new BierKeller ( HofBrau Munchen ) opened early Nov 2011 virtually next door, terrific place. Lots of big steins of beer, platters of good food and a band. It's huge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Elisa024
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel less than five minutes walk from Alexander Platz, where you can find all types of public transport in Berlin (U, S, Tram and Bus). Very nice, quiet, clean and warm room. Modern facilities (bathroom and furnitures, IKEA like). No wardrobe, just some hangers. Absolutelly recomendable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and practical hotel with a late bar!”
Reviews.Author: eg82
Reviews.Content: I couldn't fault this place. Stayed on a 4-bed room with friends and it was clean, practical and modern. The hotel facilities were great with a late bar and Internet access. Locationwise it's fantastic as close to the TV tower, the river and cathedral, and of course a main train station. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice!”
Reviews.Author: SvernerGenners
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in Berlin and we stayed in H2 hotel. Great location, just few minutes walk to Alexanderplatz. The hotel is new and very clean. The furniture is a bit like ikea in style but simple and convenient. The shower is amazing, very powerful and spacious. The breakfast could be better for € 8, would be nice to see some croissants,pastries and wider selection of cooked foods. In general It was a pleasant stay, I would definitely come back and would recommend it to young travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: noodle1973
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel in a good location in Berlin. Just a few minutes walk from underground station and overground station. Rooms a little on the small side but we did not go to Berlin to sit in our hotel room all day. The shower was lovely. Really powerful. This really is a basic hotel which you should just expect to use as a base. If you want better facilities and plush bars and lounges pay more and stay somewhere else. If you want something super clean and practical and central to transportation and the sights of Berlin then stay here. Opposite the hotel is a great restaurant called Escados serving steaks etc. Would recommend as really nice meals at good value.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Central, and Clean”
Reviews.Author: LeeyaEngel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here alone for a conference and it was perfect. The helpful staff, clean white sheets, comfortable comforter and pillows, excellent shower pressure, and the central location made the stay very comfortable. The bubbles on the bright blue headboard are not my idea of decor, but I guess it could be considered "modern". I highly recommend this hotel for a single stay, it might be a little small for a double as there is very little closet space.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the bad reviews.. great hotel for a Berlin Stay”
Reviews.Author: Griso_man
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 8th floor facing the inner courtyard. The hotel was full (some event in Berlin) the staff were friendly, no problems getting a lift (you can ignore the other reviews on the lift availability) and the breakfast was more than adequate - good selection of bread rolls, meats & cheeses, yoghurt, cereals, tea coffee and scrambled and boiled eggs. Tables were cleared and cleaned by a very attentive staff - excellent service. Free WiFi worked really well in the room (you log into the Ramada net next door). The rooms are really clean with a laminate floor (ignore comments on floor elsewhere) with a bleached wood effect. The bathroom has a great shower (big overhead shower and a hand shower head). The water does get out a little but that is not an issue and is more of a feature of the modern design than anything else. I would recommend not staying in rooms on the 8th next to the lifts - the mechanism seemed to make a strange knocking noise when the lifts are running. Hotel is not so easy to find on foot - signage is not really visible. very close to U,S bahn busses are also close by. quiet at night. would absolutely stay again. What more do you need when exploring Berlin ? You are not going to sit in your room all day so it meets the requirements for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “long weekend away for a stag break”
Reviews.Author: ianiie
Reviews.Content: 10 of us stayed from Thursday to Sunday 28th-31st July - rained none stop... we shared 2 to a room. interesting that the small rooms had two single beds but also 2 further drop down beds which would allow 4 to share. a little cramped for that :-) rooms were clean and the small bathroom had a heated floor which worked well drying our shoes. the shower was very powerfull but its door design allowed water to leak out a little. As others have said, the lifts were in constant use and this left u waiting for long periods especially first thing in the morning. We found it better to use the stairs going down and the lift going up. overall the hotel suited our purpose very well. little or no noise heard in the rooms and u can use the facilities ( bar ) next door in the Ramada.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeedingly well-situated no-frills / budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdboyd
Reviews.Content: Next door to Ramada and brand new-build Stayed two nights as part of tour group; meals, including breakfasts, were taken in the Ramada, and were very good indeed. Small-ish rooms and rubbish in-room wi fi were slight irritations.

Reviews.Title: “Higly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MustardDave
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay there. The facilities are basic but everything was modern, clean and the staff were helpful. If you are staying on business or like extra special treatment it probably isn't for you. I was on a weekend break with some of my old workmates (we go to Germany once a year) and most of the time we are out and about so all we need is a decent bed, bathroom (the showers are very good) and somewhere to hang our clothes. H2 provided just that. There is a small shop/cafe where you can get snacks, internet cafe and free wi-fi. The location is also very good as it is very close to Alexanderplatz and the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible modern hotel, aimed at groups of teenagers or families sightseeing on a budget , travel lodge with bunk beds ! Avoid !”
Reviews.Author: steveandkimberley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on business in Berlin , 3 of us in a room designed to sleep 4 ! Beds , 2 bunk beds couple of feet apart , room approx 12 feet long by about 10 feet , no wardrobes ! Air con broke ! (unable to repair ) Building work adjacent and above starts at 7 with constant. drilling ! Staff uninterested in any complaints , no iron or even ironing room ! Location not the best either at least 10 mins from Alexanderplatz, taxis are rare also , asked for another room , sorry hotel full ! Desk staff all spotty teenagers in track suits with bubble logo on, Kool ya , NOT ! It's not cheap either over £400 for 3 nights On checkout spoke to manageress who was apologetic and refunded 10 percent and also apologised for german staffs attitude ! ( she was Swiss ! ) Lol ! If you are going to stay in Berlin ( which is a fab city ) I would recommend schoenhausse apartments on schoenhouser alee opposite the famous "White trash " pub/restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price - much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: SheenaandDave
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights whilst visiting Berlin. It was really well located and rooms were of average size for Europe. I noticed that another reviewer complained about having two single beds pushed together with seperate quilts but this is normal in Germany. There was difficulty with phone reception and our particular room did not have Wifi so I'm not sure if you have to specify upon booking. The room was very clean and modern. The bathroom in particular was really nice with a huge shower head and great water pressure. Breakfast is pretty basic but has all the essentials and is buffet style. There is also a snackbar downstairs that is open 24 hours with cold beverages, pastries and confectionary. It's about a 5 minute walk to Alexanderplatz so a great place to base your travels.

Reviews.Title: “Kennel with a Loo”
Reviews.Author: rogshe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of a coach tour and stayed two nights. This was a weird hotel. It was part of the Ramada group but this was not obvious at first. The name H2 is synonymous with H2O and as such everything was designed around a bubble of water. There were circles everywhere, the designer had a field day! The room was as small as was possible for a double room; wardrobe was a four-hanger rail behind a fixed door; and the bathroom was so small the door to the loo was the same one as the separate shower area, which was very difficult to control the temperature of. You couldn’t pass one another in the room one had to move to let the other pass. There was no fridge, no tea/ coffee making facilities, no tissues, and no iron or ironing board available from reception. The three lifts were in constant use so there was always a lengthy wait, and when you got the ground floor eating area it resembled a motorway service station. The number of tables could not cope with the number of residents and the food was buffet style and minimalistic. However! Seasoned travellers would spot that some of the staff wore a Ramada badge and when questioned you found that you could use all the facilities of the Ramada next door, including the restaurant and breakfast bar. You had to pay up front for the facilities but it was well worth it. Here the food was excellent and the service polite and helpful, but it was not advertised or mentioned. Considering the hotel only opened in March 2011 it was showing signs of wear already. If I was youth hostelling then it would have been an adequate hotel, and suitable for young school parties but not for more senior travellers.

Reviews.Title: “good location, new and clean”
Reviews.Author: Travelmania79
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel. The room was a bit small but everything was clean, new and they had some English channels! Internet worked fine, It was in a good location near Alexanderplatz. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ikea ordinary”
Reviews.Author: LarryO100
Reviews.Content: Very plain budget hotel, but at non budget prices. IKEA style furnishings. We were given two beds pushed together rather than one large one as requested. It was my partners birthday & comfort would have been appreciated. The hotel seems to accommodate an inordinate amount of school parties. Not a comfortable scene for proper grown up people. Especially as they are permitted to play in the revolving doors. Reception staff are dismissive or quite frankly rude. The notable exception was the charming blond girl working in the cafeteria(yes cafeteria, no bar or restaurant). Sorry I didn't get her name. Only real positive was the power shower. It would seem to be part of the Ramada group, prices are too high for basically an upmarket hostel.

Reviews.Title: “New nice and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ann25v
Reviews.Content: A nice new hotel with good location: close proximity to the city center and U-Bahn and S-Bahn stations. Friendly personnel, attractive price. New clean and cozy rooms, but rather small. There were few unimportant disadvantages: - no hangers (shoulders) in the room, so if you travel with business suit or dress, that won't be easy to store it in the room, - breakfasts are not poor, but there're no any hot food (only boiled eggs), - sometimes in the mornings there was a noise of construction works.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but ...”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravelerVillach
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent and the rooms are equivalent to the adjacent Ramada. Internet access is free! The hotel is brand new and the staff is struggling to handle the service. A major issue is that mobile phone reception within the building is not working!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location,but a lot of fixes to be done”
Reviews.Author: ddn81
Reviews.Content: To start with the let me mention that the Hotel is still under construction so may be fixes will be done later. But few things which I think are complete had some issues. Poistives: 1)Location:Its at the hear of Alexzanderplatz , well connected to all the tourist place. You can walk to many attraction or take Bus 100 from there. 2) Price:Is affordable and reasonable 3) Staff: Freindly , helpful and speak English 4) Cleanliness: As expected from a standard good hotel.So Satisfied Negatives: 1)Bed: The pillows are two thin/soft. As I was there for only one night we dint bother to ask for another pair , we just folded them. But it needs to improve. 2)TV: They have this round and stylish Cupboard/coat hanger, which looks good but blocks the view from one side. 3)Floor: Its not smooth,you can feel the roughness nd see cracks on the wooden floor. 4) Bathroom:The Glass door of the Shower cubicle had gap so as you take a shower , the floor outside the cubicle will aslo het wet. 5) Breakfast: It was mostly cold breakfast, so we dint feel its value for money (€8 pp). We just walked to the McDonalds cafe nearby. But again as the Hotel is yet to be completed (we arrived 3days after opening) I hope things will improve.
